bwwExcerpt: As in many a Disney stage production, the big showstopper isn't even human: During ''A Whole New World,'' a flying carpet carries our lovers aloft in a night-time ride, swooping and spinning with how'd-they-do-that wonder. (Jim Steinmeyer and Jeremy Chernick are credited with designing the onstage illusions and special effects.) It deserves its own curtain call.
showScoreExcerpt: "This is one of the better Disney stage musicals, complete with several eye-popping production numbers."
